sentence.Network_en: Not a single mu of land is left uncultivated in our village.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们村没有一亩荒废的土地.

sentence.Network_en: The world had vast uncultivated land areas.
sentence.Network_cn: 世界上还有广阔的未开垦的陆地.

entry.def: If land is uncultivated, there are no crops growing on it.

example.tran: 基本上还未曾开垦的平原

example.ex: ...an area left uncultivated to attract insects and small animals.
example.tran: 为吸引昆虫和小动物而有意留下的一片未开垦区域

means.word_mean: 1. (of land or fields) not prepared for raising crops;
3. characteristic of a person who is not cultivated or does not have intellectual tastes;

auth_sentence.content: He was a coarse, uncultivated man.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was a coarse, uncultivated man.

auth_sentence.content: Part of the virtue of that rough patch of garden is the uncultivated soil.
auth_sentence.res_content: Part of the virtue of that rough patch of garden is the uncultivated soil.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Part of the virtue of that rough patch of garden is the uncultivated soil.

auth_sentence.content: I think we have seen as much land as might serve all the people in Britain uncultivated and covered with wood.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think we have seen as much land as might serve all the people in Britain uncultivated and covered with wood.
